name: murmur
content:
murmur verb
(SPEAK QUIETLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 [ I or T ] to speak or say something very quietly: [ + speech ] "I love you," she murmured. He was murmuring to himself.humorous He murmured sweet nothings (= romantic talk) in her ear.

murmur verb
(COMPLAIN)
[ I ] to complain about something that you disagree with or dislike, but not in a public way: They were murmuring about the boss's nephew getting the job.

murmur noun
(SOUND)
C2 [ C ] the sound of something being said very quietly: A murmur of agreement came from the crowd.
[ S ] a soft continuous sound: The murmur of the waves on the beach lulled me to sleep.

murmur noun
(COMPLAINT)
[ C ] a complaint that is expressed privately: After the report was published, there were murmurs of discontent around the office.
